A First Maybe

443 words written on Fri, Oct 8 2004

today i was solicited by a prostitute. i think.

i was in oak cliff. i had just stopped at a texaco to fill up my tires, which were much too low for their own good. i‚Äôm pulling out of texaco‚Ä¶

oh shit i have to admit that i smoke to tell this story. oh well. i think most of you know or could have guessed.

i see a woman standing on the sidewalk talking on her cell phone, looking like she‚Äôs ready to go out to the clubs or something, except it‚Äôs 3:15 in the afternoon, and i think to myself, ‚Äúthat looks like a prostitute!‚Äù which i thought odd because of the neighborhood (maybe not?), so then i thought, ‚Äúnah.‚Äù

she sees me and gives me the sign for ‚Äúcan i bum a smoke?‚Äù so i roll down my passenger side window and give her one. and the conversation went like this. i‚Äôll leave it to you to decide:

‚Äúthanks. can you give me a ride?‚Äù

‚Äúum, sure, where to?‚Äù thinking that if it‚Äôs the direction i‚Äôm heading anyway, no problem.

‚Äúi don‚Äôt know. i need to make some money.‚Äù

‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Äù thinking: wtf? oh shit! ‚Äúno.‚Äù

‚Äúno?‚Äù she acted surprised. i‚Äôm wondering, did i miss something? is there some secret communication between prostitutes and their clients i‚Äôm not privy to? did i give the sign unknowningly? and worst of all, do i look like that kind of guy? (don‚Äôt answer that question!)

i pulled away. end of story.

i sold art tonight, which was a great feeling. an art prof bought a piece. like, she has her phd in ART, people. that is very cool. and i think i might have been the only person to sell work tonight. i‚Äôm also pretty sure mine was the least expensive there (out of something like 15 artists).

after that show i went to see my favorite band, the happy bullets, play at my favorite bar, sons of hermann. their set made me very happy indeed. after they played a new band with local luminaries from bedhead/the new year and some other bigger local acts played and they were also very good.

and i didn‚Äôt drink a thing.

more happy story tomorrow.

like my local barkeep would say: ‚Äúeven a blind squirrel will back into a nut every now and then.‚Äù

*Update: I‚Äôve since remembered this one time, driving from Czech Rep to Germany, through a town notorious for prostitutes (border town and all), a woman flashed us (there was someone else with me). There was, like, snow on the ground at the time. She was standing next to a little hut. Kinda scary.
